comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: The collision between the two goods trains happened 5 minutes before 1:00am, Thursday 11 September 1884. One man, believed to be the drover, and a number of sheep were killed. The clearing of the line "was carried out with expedition", dating the photo to the day of the accident. - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/13565458 See also: [Digital ID: 17420_a014_a014000958] "... the engine of the mixed train, being propelled not only by its own impetus, but by the momentum of about 30 loaded trucks behind it, left the rails and climbed the break van and the sheep-truck of the standing train in a very remarkable manner."
